intro: Sommera sabiceoides, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types.
